Chronic hepatitis C refers to a chronic infection of the liver caused by the hepatitis C virus. Hemolytic anemia is a condition where there is a destruction of red blood cells, leading to a decrease in the number of circulating red blood cells and anemia. In the context of the paragraph, it is mentioned that chronic hepatitis C treatment with interferon and ribavirin can cause hemolytic anemia.
